body.p: As described in Getting Started, the console is a Java process that acts as the coordinator for the other processes; hosts a user interface; collates and displays statistics; and provides script editing and distribution.
When you run The Grinder, a single console process is started on one of your computers. The agent processes on your load injector machines connect to this console.
There are several types of user interface, described in more detail over the following pages.

ul.li: The Classic Interface, a graphical user interface written using the Java Swing framework
The Console Service, a RESTful API
The Web Interface, a HTML5 user interface, accessible using a web browser
